other_tests.findings: Sludge-filled gallbladder with wall thickening and pericholecystic fluid, consistent with acute cholecystitis. No hepatic or common bile-duct dilatation or choledocholithiasis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Findings confirmed with magnetic resonance cholangiopancreatography (MRCP) showing gallbladder-wall thickening and irregularity.

other_tests.findings: Gallbladder-wall thickening with associated pericholecystic fluid and moderate dependent sludge. Fatty infiltration of the liver and splenomegaly noted.
Reticulocyte percentage of 3.2% (normal range, 0.5 to 2.2) and absolute reticulocyte count of 172,100 per cubic millimeter (normal range, 31,500 to 108,800).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Sustained reticulocytosis observed indicates ongoing hemolysis.

other_tests.findings: Showed Pappenheimer bodies (iron-containing granules) but no spur cells, schistocytes, or spherocytes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A perioperative peripheral-blood smear reviewed after cholecystectomy showed occasional spherocytes.
Confirmed the diagnosis of hereditary spherocytosis.
